intro: Miconia lithophila, commonly known as the rock miconia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and showy, violet-blue bracts. The plant typically grows on rocky outcrops and is adapted to coastal or limestone environments. It produces small, white flowers that are often surrounded by colorful, leaf-like structures. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
